meanings.definition: A person or thing that carries or supports something
meanings.sent1: The bearers of the heavy boxes struggled to lift them onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: The ants are known as strong bearers, carrying food many times their weight back to the nest.
meanings.sent3: The bearers of the message were so tiny that they had to shout to be heard.
meanings.sent4: The bearers of hope carried the torch through the darkest of times.
meanings.sent5: The bearers of the ancient artifact moved slowly and carefully to avoid any damage.

meanings.definition: A person who presents or brings news, messages, or invitations
meanings.sent1: The bearers of the good news were greeted with cheers and smiles.
meanings.sent2: The mailman is a familiar bearer of letters and packages in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The bearers of the invitation arrived in style, dressed in elegant attire.
meanings.sent4: The bearers of gossip whispered secrets in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The bearers of the weather report predicted a sunny day ahead.

meanings.definition: A person who holds a position or title, especially in an official capacity
meanings.sent1: The bearers of the royal titles were adorned in elaborate robes and crowns.
meanings.sent2: The president is a prominent bearer of authority in the country.
meanings.sent3: The bearers of the office keys were entrusted with great responsibility.
meanings.sent4: The bearers of the judge's verdict listened intently to the arguments.
meanings.sent5: The bearers of the flag marched proudly in the parade, representing their nation.
